wikipedia_page.main: Arthur Henry Douthwaite (13 February 1896 – 24 September 1974) was a British doctor, Vice President of the Royal College of Physicians and a prolific medical textbook writer. He was described as the foremost expert on heroin in Britain in the 1950s, or as a leading authority on opiates and ne was called as an expert witness for the prosecution in the trial of Dr John Bodkin Adams for the murder of  Mrs Edith Morrell.
